Edge-case path: Audience with the Absolute (captured Nightsong then messed up Z'rell)
BossFightIntro.how_to_trigger: * oe unlockrooftop* oe mooassaultGo to the MOO rooftop and speak to Ketheric.

Z'rell is confident that she'll put the players and their allies down here, and shows no fear.

Protect Isobel.killcombatteleport S_MOO_KethericHoundFollow through with dialogue and accept to deal with the goblins.crimes -disableteleport S_MOO_KethericHoundinteract with Hound, let her sniff youoe mooassault_alivethis will trigger moonrise assault eventteleport S_MOO_KethericHound

Once Ketheric flees she will move up to the roof to offer recruitment.
Jaheira.how_to_trigger: Free Nightsong (oe mooassault_alive 1)Walk accross the bridge and talk to Jaheira

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger.synopsis: Antony is a Harper who fights with us at Moonrise.

AD_JaheiraMoveForward.synopsis: Jaheira yells to her Harpers and Flaming Fist to hold the main floor of Moonrise after the player has cleared the enemies during the assault. This is the last push before confronting Ketheric on the roof.

PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning.synopsis: The player has entered the Moonrise prison during the assault (with some warning against in most cases). This is a final heads up to the player that the skeletons they are fighting will just keep respawning with no reward, so it is best to leave asap.

AssaultHarper_004.how_to_trigger: Trigger MOO's assault state with the Harpers / FF on your side.

automatic_ordering.reasoning: After inspecting the session details and their trigger conditions, several clear ordering and exclusivity relationships emerge. First, in the boss‐fight sequence on the rooftop, the player first meets Ketheric on the roof (BossFightIntro), then when his health is low a cinematic occurs (FirstKethericInterruption) and, during the fight, Ketheric is teleported away (KethericLeaving). Once these events have occurred the post‐combat PAD is triggered (PAD_AfterKethericCombat). In addition, before reaching the rooftop the player wins a fight near the door (PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric), which must come before initiating the boss fight sequence. Separately, Z'rell’s dialogue is split into two parts – a callout when she is waiting in the tower (AD_ZrellCallout) and a combat dialogue when the fight with her actually starts (AD_ZrellCombat) – so the “callout” must come before the combat. In another branch, if the player has Jaheira as a follower then her dialogue for trying to leave the area (AD_JaheiraFollowerLeave) should only occur after her initial arrival/greeting (Jaheira). Finally, there is an alternate method described by the “TentaclelessJump” session that appears to be an alternative way to reach the roof; therefore, if the player takes that teleport path, they will skip the rooftop boss fight sequence (BossFightIntro). This makes TentaclelessJump and BossFightIntro mutually exclusive. An additional mutually exclusive case is found with Z'rell: depending on circumstances, if Jaheira or Florrick are present, AD_ZrellTaunt is used; otherwise AD_ZrellCallout is triggered. Thus AD_ZrellTaunt and AD_ZrellCallout cannot both play in the same path.

AD_GuardJumper_0.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_GuardJumper_0.text: Can't believe you'd betray the Absolute. Idiot.

AD_GuardJumper_1.speaker: Acolyte Marls
AD_GuardJumper_1.text: Believe - can't. Idiot! The Absolute... be-tray.

AD_AccessCultistCombat_0.speaker: Radija
AD_AccessCultistCombat_0.text: You'll die before you reach my lord. Perhaps then you will be obedient.
AD_AccessCultistCombat_0.context: NodeContext: Grim, angry. Promising to kill us and resurrect us as a more obedient slave.

AD_JaheiraSolo_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_0.text: Here we stand in the lion's den, but the lions are you and I.

AD_JaheiraSolo_1.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_1.text: Come what may, we'll be the tempest that blows clear this accursed place.

AD_JaheiraSolo_2.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_2.text: Once more unto battle. Once more to save Baldur's Gate.
AD_JaheiraSolo_2.context: NodeContext: Interior monologue - defiant but subdued

AD_JaheiraSolo_3.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_3.text: At long last, the dynasty of Thorms shall be dethroned.

AD_JaheiraSolo_4.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_4.text: Shadow to shadow. Soon the final reckoning.
AD_JaheiraSolo_4.context: NodeContext: Interior monologue - defiant but subdued

AD_JaheiraSolo_5.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraSolo_5.text: My blade will taste of your flesh, Ketheric, and so settle a century-old score.
AD_JaheiraSolo_5.context: NodeContext: Interior monologue - defiant but subdued

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_1.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_1.text: Just tell me what you need.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_3.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_3.text: It's a grim task, picking provisions from the dead.

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_6.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_6.text: But the way I hear it, the fighting's not done yet. You need to resupply?

HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_5.speaker: Quartermaster Talli
HavenOutcasts_HarperQuartermaster_5.context: NodeContext: Blessing - as absent as saying 'god bless', not overly pious

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_0.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_0.text: You fight as well as any Harper. Careful, or Jaheira might have to keep you.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_0.context: NodeContext: Wry, a little breathless. Lull in battle.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_1.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_1.text: That army outside won't be long noticing this mess. We need to get this done - quickly.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_2.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_2.text: We can beat an army that size to the city, I reckon. But only if we get going now.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_3.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_3.text: Finally on the front foot. Let's see how they like being turned out of their beds.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_3.context: NodeContext: Hint of bloodlust, enthusiasm - she's relishing getting to fight back for once

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_4.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_4.text: Ketheric's done, but that army's already on the move. This isn't done yet.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_5.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_5.text: I'd like to pull this whole heap down when we're done. A cairn for all the Harpers who died here.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_6.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_6.text: We'll talk when this is done. Preferably squatting over Ketheric's corpse.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_6.context: NodeContext: Anger, but not at us

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_7.speaker: Harper Naysa
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_7.text: Can't stand this place. You can tell there's been naught but evil here for a century.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Ranger_7.context: NodeContext: Wry, a little breathless. Lull in battle.

BossFightIntro_64.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_64.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
BossFightIntro_64.context:
CinematicNodeContext: The player approaches Ketheric; he is shivering; anxious; manic with the reality that he has been made vulnerable.

Ketheric jerkily turns toward the player with hatred in his eyes.InternalNodeContext: INTRO: Before initial fight

BossFightIntro_67.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_67.text: YOU! What have you done?! What have you done to me?!
BossFightIntro_67.context:

BossFightIntro_3.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_3.text: You desecrate my halls. Kill my faithful. What heresy twists inside you?!

BossFightIntro_18.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_18.text: You're mortal again, Thorm. I've come to finish you.

BossFightIntro_92.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_92.text: Impossible. You are a thrall - a slave!
BossFightIntro_92.context: NodeContext: Furious; still with that slavering fury

BossFightIntro_111.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_111.text: A pawn cannot lecture the Chosen of the gods.

BossFightIntro_51.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_51.text: This is your end, General Thorm. Face me, and die with dignity.

BossFightIntro_19.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_19.text: You were feeding off Nightsong for a century. No longer.

BossFightIntro_57.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_57.text: How dare you interfere? You are like the digits of a hand - it is for you to act, not to decide.

BossFightIntro_59.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_59.text: You serve the Absolute. You. Serve. ME! Bow, you dog. BOW!
BossFightIntro_59.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

BossFightIntro_35.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_35.text: Surrender now, and I'll consider letting you live.

BossFightIntro_79.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_79.text: You've come this far. You've stripped your enemy of his advantage. Why would you show mercy now?

BossFightIntro_73.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_73.text: I'm not like you, Ketheric. My only interest is what is right.

BossFightIntro_109.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_109.text: Who decides what is right? The gods did not care for right and wrong when they dismantled my life piece by piece.

BossFightIntro_76.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_76.text: And when I tried to buy it back, it cost me everything - everything.

BossFightIntro_58.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_58.text: We are copper pieces in their belts. Tokens to be traded for scraps.

BossFightIntro_81.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_81.text: You have beaten me, True Soul. But the gods beat me first.
BossFightIntro_81.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

BossFightIntro_47.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_47.text: And you will decide what is right?

BossFightIntro_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_1.text: You who have begged, stolen, killed - same as I - to make it to this tower?

BossFightIntro_103.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_103.text: I think not, True soul. You serve the Absolute. You serve me. Bow, you dog. BOW!
BossFightIntro_103.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)' InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

BossFightIntro_36.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_36.text: I may or I may not. But if you try to attack me, I will crush your skull.

BossFightIntro_66.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_66.text: We're not so different, it seems. We both want what we want, and no opposition, no resistance will prevent us.

BossFightIntro_30.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_30.text: And yet... you have beaten me.

BossFightIntro_31.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_31.text: It has taken a century of misfortune. A century of loss. A century of regret.

BossFightIntro_52.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_52.text: And now... perhaps it is over.
BossFightIntro_52.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

BossFightIntro_43.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_43.text: I can help you, Ketheric - if you let me.

BossFightIntro_6.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player reaches out to Ketheric but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

BossFightIntro_71.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_71.text: Rise, you dog! Retribution has come, and her sword is my sword!

BossFightIntro_116.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_116.text: Ha! Ketheric Thorm would sooner die than lay down his rank cause. Isn't that right, General?

BossFightIntro_40.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_40.text: I was a fool to hesitate. Power like mine cannot be hidden, cannot be cowed. But power like mine has a price. A price I am destined to pay.
BossFightIntro_40.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

BossFightIntro_112.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_112.text: You have one last chance to bow. Once it's gone, I'll have no choice but to destroy you both. Do you hear?! BOW!

BossFightIntro_54.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_54.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
BossFightIntro_54.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric looks over the balcony to the playerInternalNodeContext: NIGHTSONG

BossFightIntro_85.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_85.text: He will crumble at the power of your touch - give him all you have.

BossFightIntro_11.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_11.text: THE GODS FIGHT AT OUR SIDE!
BossFightIntro_11.context: NodeContext: Ending big speech before combat

BossFightIntro_28.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_28.text: Your word's as good as mine, it seems. Very well.
BossFightIntro_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

BossFightIntro_41.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_41.text: It was destined to come to this. The power I've accrued. The enemies I've cowed. Returned to me at last. Returned to me for the final time.

BossFightIntro_10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_10.text: Aylin. I was hoping you'd come.
BossFightIntro_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

BossFightIntro_50.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_50.text: Ha! Ha! Free from your shackles; free from the pets you sicced on me for a hundred years. Do I frighten you, old man?

BossFightIntro_62.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_62.text: Let us finish this, Aylin. I have a price to pay for my power. It will cost me your life - for my own, I have already paid.

BossFightIntro_72.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_72.text: It isn't too late, Ketheric. Your story doesn't end here.

BossFightIntro_22.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_22.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric  raises his head to look at us, but he is immediately knocked away by a flash, revealing Nightsong in his place (she has flown in and knocked him aside).

BossFightIntro_9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_9.text: I am the Chosen - the Chosen. Did you know that?
BossFightIntro_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric is on one knee, head down, and begins to rise when he suddenly stops short, as though hearing something.

BossFightIntro_83.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_83.text: I gave up everything. My family. My life. I cannot stop here. I must finish what I started. One way or another.
BossFightIntro_83.context: NodeContext: Mix of resolve and sadness here. He doesn't really want to finish what he started, but he knows it's too late now. Foreshadowing the fact that if you get this node, he will try to help you later (though he will fail)

BossFightIntro_16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_16.text: Do what I say. Prostrate yourself before me. For if you do not, your suffering will be worse.
BossFightIntro_16.context: NodeContext: He's trying to help us here; he almost stopped being evil but he can't give in yet.

BossFightIntro_20.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_20.text: It is better that you bow. Do you hear me? BOW!
BossFightIntro_20.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)' InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one. Can be a bit more of an extended yell

BossFightIntro_101.context: CinematicNodeContext: the player is knocked backward.

BossFightIntro_84.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_84.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
BossFightIntro_84.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric stands up quickly, hatred in his eyes. Gestures to cast a big, scary looking necro spell aimed at the player. The player shields themselves, but at the moment where it seems Ketheric is about to launch a fatal blow, a flash of light appears, and Ketheric is pushed away and to the ground. Nightsong is standing in his place.InternalNodeContext: NIGHTSONG

BossFightIntro_97.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_97.context: CinematicNodeContext:  The player shields themselves, but at the moment where it seems Ketheric is about to launch a fatal blow, a flash of light appears, and Ketheric is pushed away and to the ground. Nightsong is standing in his place.NodeContext: to Nightsong

BossFightIntro_75.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_75.text: How good it is to see you again, Ketheric. At last you've found a god-master that suits you, it seems.

BossFightIntro_93.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_93.text: Aylin. The thief. You stole Isobel from me, and now you think you'll take my life in the bargain?

BossFightIntro_80.speaker: Nightsong
BossFightIntro_80.text: You dare to speak her name? After your crimes innumerable, you would evoke her before me?
BossFightIntro_80.context: NodeContext: cold as ice - still talking to ketheric

BossFightIntro_55.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_55.text: Enough! This ends here and now - at last.
BossFightIntro_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric clambers to his feet.

BossFightIntro_49.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_49.text: The Prism. You've had it all this time - you worm! You will bow before me. And if you will not bow, you will break.
BossFightIntro_49.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric begins combat wit hthe player.

BossFightIntro_68.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_68.text: Come quietly, and you'll be spared.

BossFightIntro_2.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_2.text: Seeing one's enemies cowed never gets old.

BossFightIntro_96.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_96.text: Listen to yourself. A mouse who fancies itself an eagle.

BossFightIntro_89.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_89.text: I will not be threatened by a thrall. A slave. A mere finger in the fist that will crush who and when I demand.

BossFightIntro_107.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_107.text: Bow before me - before the Absolute! BOW!
BossFightIntro_107.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)
NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

BossFightIntro_98.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_98.text: A higher power wants you to live.

BossFightIntro_17.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_17.text: It doesn't make sense. I - I don't understand.

BossFightIntro_37.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_37.text: I was given - I was told -

BossFightIntro_4.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_4.text: The gods... We are so little before them. So small.
BossFightIntro_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: He stumbles, and falls to his knees.

BossFightIntro_106.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_106.text: Haven't you figured it out by now, True Soul? I do not serve the Absolute. The Absolute serves me. Bow, you dog. BOW!
BossFightIntro_106.context:
CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric tries to psionically force the player to bow.

|Orpheus presents itself,  from the player's inventory, shakes, and emits a pulse. Ketheric shields himself but is pushed back (not knocked down)'InternalNodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)NodeContext: (his voice changes, distorts, with the echoes and whispers of the elder brain/ Absolute, showing they speak as one)

BossFightIntro_74.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_74.text: Live? You misunderstand me, True Soul. And it will be your undoing.
BossFightIntro_74.context: NodeContext: Live as in 'live and let live,' not live as in 'live from new york, it's saturday night'

BossFightIntro_114.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_114.text: You've seen what I'm capable of. Surrender now, and I'll consider letting you live.

BossFightIntro_95.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_95.text: Melodia wanted more for you than this, Ketheric. Stop, and you may redeem yourself yet.

BossFightIntro_104.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_104.text: There is no redemption. Can't you see? It is too late.

BossFightIntro_65.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_65.text: If Melodia could see all I've done, she'd know... she'd know her husband died long ago, with Isobel.

BossFightIntro_27.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_27.text: Unlike Isobel, he could not be brought back.

BossFightIntro_14.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_14.text: You're wrong, Ketheric. It isn't too late for you.

BossFightIntro_91.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_91.text: I haven't forgotten her embrace. Melodia's. Nor Selûne's.

BossFightIntro_94.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_94.text: Melodia is waiting for you in the afterlife. Return to Selûne, and your souls will be reunited.

BossFightIntro_32.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_32.text: I wish it could be so. I do.

BossFightIntro_60.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_60.text: But the Moonmaiden did not intervene when my life was dismantled piece by piece.

BossFightIntro_100.speaker: Player
BossFightIntro_100.text: So you'll continue this spectacle of violence? To what end?

BossFightIntro_45.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_45.text: This is no spectacle. This is payment.

BossFightIntro_46.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_46.text: My life was dismantled piece by piece. First my wife was taken - my wife! And then my beautiful daughter. My life was forfeit. Gone. Finished.

BossFightIntro_86.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
BossFightIntro_86.text: You attempt to intrude upon my heart? To destroy me from within? No, True Soul. You forget yourself.

Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_TopOfTowerBackup_0.text: It's all up to you now. Ketheric awaits.

Executioner_27.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_27.text: Fascinating to see someone so favoured squander the regard of the Absolute. How very sad.

Executioner_7.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Executioner_7.text: The Absolute's regard is poison, Z'rell.
Executioner_7.context: NodeContext: angry, but not shouting - more of a quiet menace. Looking forward to her vengeance.

Executioner_26.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_26.text: It was you. You destroyed the Nightsong.

Executioner_20.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_20.text: How could you do this to us? To Ketheric? To the Absolute?

Executioner_10.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_10.text: You've turned your back on our Chosen in the most heinous way. And our retribution will be terrible.

Executioner_6.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Executioner_6.text: There will be no retribution, Z'rell. Only vengeance - and that shall be mine.
Executioner_6.context: NodeContext: angry, but not shouting - more of a quiet menace. Looking forward to her vengeance.

Executioner_1.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_1.text: How funny. How sad. You think you're going to survive this, don't you?

Executioner_39.speaker: Player
Executioner_39.text: Surrender, and I'll let you live.

Executioner_14.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_14.text: Surrender, and I'll kill you quickly.

Executioner_38.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_38.text: You dare show yourself here, after all you've done?
Executioner_38.context: NodeContext: impressed to have seen a legendary hero (Jaheira) up close and personal - really wants to kill said hero

Executioner_25.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_25.text: You have betrayed me, you have betrayed General Thorm - you have betrayed our god!
Executioner_25.context: NodeContext: building fury, peaking on final phrase

Executioner_36.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_36.text: And for what? These Harpers? Moonrise will be their tomb - and in death, you will all serve the Absolute.

Executioner_35.speaker: Nightwarden Minthara
Executioner_35.text: I will never serve the Absolute again, Z'rell, and I will take your prattling tongue as a reminder of this moment.
Executioner_35.context: NodeContext: angry, but not shouting - more of a quiet menace. Looking forward to her vengeance.

Executioner_30.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_30.context: NodeContext: Preparing for a big fight, but calm and confident - this line spoken to her allies gathered behind her. Doesn't turn to them.

Executioner_41.speaker: Player
Executioner_41.text: Surrender, and I'll let you live.

Executioner_40.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_40.text: Like a kitten roaring at a tiger.
Executioner_40.context: NodeContext: addressed to player, amused and confidently dismissing their attempt to have her surrender before a big fight

Executioner_31.speaker: Player
Executioner_31.text: I've looked forward to killing you since the moment we met.

Executioner_5.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_5.text: You hid it well. I thought you'd be another notch on my bedpost, but instead I'll make a trophy of your bones.

Executioner_4.speaker: Player
Executioner_4.text: Ketheric is already in hiding. He left you to die.

Executioner_34.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_34.text: The General is not hiding - he is preparing the next stage of our conquest. You really have no idea what's coming, do you?

Executioner_43.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
Executioner_43.text: And for what? That little firefly buzzing around overhead? I'll crush you first, then her - and in death, you will all serve the Absolute.

CrestfallenHound_SwA_0.speaker: Narrator
CrestfallenHound_SwA_0.text: *Her mournful eyes take in every detail of the room, but the hound looks right through you. She's lost in thoughts and memories.*

CrestfallenHound_SwA_1.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA_1.text: That scent - the Selûnite magic on your skin - it fills this place.

CrestfallenHound_SwA_2.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA_2.text: It fills my head with things I miss. I cannot remember them, but I do miss them.
CrestfallenHound_SwA_2.context: NodeContext: Sadly - thinking of a past life, barely remembered

CrestfallenHound_SwA_3.speaker: Narrator
CrestfallenHound_SwA_3.text: *The sounds of battle do not disturb the creature. She seems to be in another time, another place.*

CrestfallenHound_SwA_4.speaker: Squire
CrestfallenHound_SwA_4.text: I know the battle is outside, but there's peace here. And I'm tired of fighting.

KethericLeaving_0.speaker: Narrator
KethericLeaving_0.context: InternalNodeContext: The tentacle "picks up" Nightsong and Ketheric. (TBD edge-case: Nightsong's body is not on the roof anymore or is in an inventory)

AssaultHarper_001_0.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_0.text: Onwards. Ketheric can't hide from us now!
AssaultHarper_001_0.context: NodeContext: A lull in battle - fervent, caught up in the moment

AssaultHarper_001_1.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_1.text: That light below... We've already weakened Shar's hold here.
AssaultHarper_001_1.context: NodeContext: Fervent - referring to the single path of light created by Nightsong

AssaultHarper_001_2.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_2.text: Selûne willing, we'll get the order to move soon. I don't like camping above a godsdamned illithid nest.

AssaultHarper_001_3.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_3.text: A colony. A godsdamned elder brain. I faced a lone mind flayer, once, and it slaughtered half my squad.
AssaultHarper_001_3.context: NodeContext: IN SLIGHT AWE OF WHAT WE FACED

AssaultHarper_001_4.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_4.text: That figure... Selûne herself fights with us.
AssaultHarper_001_4.context: NodeContext: Wonder, a little nervous before a battle.

AssaultHarper_001_5.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_5.text: We're in it now, whatever comes.

AssaultHarper_001_7.speaker: Harper Lanni
AssaultHarper_001_7.text: Let's get the bastard - lead the way.
AssaultHarper_001_7.context: NodeContext: A lull in battle - fervent, caught up in the moment

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_0.speaker: Harper Lymn
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_0.text: The false god creeps. The city must wake.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_0.context: NodeContext: Referencing the fact that we need to get to the city.

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_3.speaker: Harper Lymn
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_3.text: Long dark below. But light above - light, at last.
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_3.context: NodeContext: She senses the illithid colony stretching away below - but isn't scared

HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_5.speaker: Harper Lymn
HavenOutcasts_DockGuard_Left_Ranger_5.text: Light in the sky. Light at last.

FirstKethericInterruption_0.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_0.text: Enough. You know as well as I that you cannot harm me. I am your superior in every way.

FirstKethericInterruption_5.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_5.text: Bow before me, and I may finish you quickly.
FirstKethericInterruption_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric begins to bend the player to his will with a surge of psionic might, when the box flys out and pushes Ketheric and the player back.

FirstKethericInterruption_15.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_15.text: The Prism! You've had it this whole time, you rat.

FirstKethericInterruption_2.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_2.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric staggers, weakened. Nightsong spreads her wings and lifts off the ground, preparing for a final blowNodeContext: Ragged breathing, hunched over in terrible shape

FirstKethericInterruption_13.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_13.text: You must return to your prison. And my daughter must be reclaimed.
FirstKethericInterruption_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: At the sound of 'my daughter' Nigthsong is distracted and looks in concern - she doesn't know Isobel is alive.InternalNodeContext: to Nightsong

FirstKethericInterruption_7.speaker: Nightsong
FirstKethericInterruption_7.context: CinematicNodeContext: Nightsong is shocked; just then, Ketheric gestures with his arm, NodeContext: At first, trying to understand what ketheric means. Incredulous - only thing that could have stopped her mid-rampage was hearing the name of the lover she thought dead

FirstKethericInterruption_4.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle BURSTS through a wall beside Ketheric

FirstKethericInterruption_6.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_6.text: You will fall as sure as she. This has only begun.
FirstKethericInterruption_6.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle slaps Nightsong from the sky, then zaps Ketheric and Nightsong down into the colony, leaving a crevice through which the player can follow.InternalNodeContext: to player

FirstKethericInterruption_16.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_16.text: You must return to your prison. And I must return to my daughter.

FirstKethericInterruption_1.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_1.text: You must return to your prison. And my daughter must be reborn - one last time.

FirstKethericInterruption_9.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_9.context: NodeContext: Breathing is ragged, he's in bad shape.

FirstKethericInterruption_8.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_8.text: You have no idea what you're meddling with. You're a pawn - a slave - to forces you cannot comprehend.

FirstKethericInterruption_11.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_11.text: I am the Chosen, and you are nothing. Follow. See.
FirstKethericInterruption_11.context: CinematicNodeContext: The tentacle zaps him away, leaving a crevice through which the player can follow.

FirstKethericInterruption_10.speaker: Ketheric Thorm
FirstKethericInterruption_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: Ketheric staggers, weakened. Nightsong lifts herself up, then spreads her wings and lifts off the ground, preparing for a final blowNodeContext: Ragged breathing, hunched over in terrible shape

AssaultFlamingFist_001_0.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_0.text: Watching gods. These poor bastards actually die believing.
AssaultFlamingFist_001_0.context: NodeContext: Vague disbelief, regret - they're killing people who believe in a nonsense god.

AssaultFlamingFist_001_1.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_1.text: I only took this expedition for the hazard pay. I'd say we've earned it.
AssaultFlamingFist_001_1.context: NodeContext: Gallows humour - standing at the end of a bloody battle, and she's playing the simple mercenary

AssaultFlamingFist_001_2.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_2.text: Enough. We need to put an end to this.
AssaultFlamingFist_001_2.context: NodeContext: Shelving her emotions, wants to press ahead and fight

AssaultFlamingFist_001_3.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_3.text: These cult-nutters don't die easy. We've lost a few of ours already.

AssaultFlamingFist_001_4.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_4.text: Give no quarter. The time for that's passed.

AssaultFlamingFist_001_5.speaker: Fist Nipawa
AssaultFlamingFist_001_5.text: Seems you'll be the one to save the Duke. Maybe we can split the bonus, hm?
AssaultFlamingFist_001_5.context: NodeContext: Gallows humour - standing at the end of a bloody battle, and she's playing the simple mercenary

DarkUrgeButlerReminder_0.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder_0.text: Fine day to storm a tower! Carry on! Don't mind a frail old Butler.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder_1.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder_1.text: I'll be no trouble! Back on the warpath with you!

DarkUrgeButlerReminder_2.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder_2.text: That was rather rude, wasn't it? To assume I am content to be killed by one of low breeding.

DarkUrgeButlerReminder_3.speaker: Sceleritas Fel
DarkUrgeButlerReminder_3.text: I want you to go away, and think about what you did.

AssaultFlamingFist_002_0.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_0.text: Come on. Plenty more to do yet.
AssaultFlamingFist_002_0.context: NodeContext: Heat of battle, focused and not really interested in conversation.

AssaultFlamingFist_002_1.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_1.text: That can't be the last of them. Wherever they're hiding, we'll root them out.

AssaultFlamingFist_002_2.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_2.context: NodeContext: Fierce, wants to press on with the fighting

AssaultFlamingFist_002_3.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_3.text: Taking on a tower with no siege engines. Wonderful.
AssaultFlamingFist_002_3.context: NodeContext: Not afraid, just disgruntled. She'll get on with it either way.

AssaultFlamingFist_002_4.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_4.text: We have the High Harper. I suppose that's almost as good as a trebuchet.

AssaultFlamingFist_002_5.speaker: Fist Helena
AssaultFlamingFist_002_5.text: Stay sharp. All it takes is one stray arrow.
AssaultFlamingFist_002_5.context: NodeContext: Vigilant - battle's in a lull, but she's staying ready

AssaultHarper_003_0.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003_0.text: This place... stinks of blood and fear. That is all the Absolute offers.
AssaultHarper_003_0.context: NodeContext: Disgust and scorn for the Absolute.

AssaultHarper_003_1.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003_1.text: Go and do what you must. We'll guard your back.

AssaultHarper_003_2.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003_2.text: A lot of Harpers died stopping Ketheric the first time around. We'll make it stick this time.
AssaultHarper_003_2.context: NodeContext: Serious, a hint of ferocity behind it

AssaultHarper_003_3.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003_3.context: NodeContext: Disgust and scorn for the Absolute.

AssaultHarper_003_5.speaker: Harper Lilineth
AssaultHarper_003_5.text: Ketheric can hide from us no longer.

PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric_0.speaker: Player
PAD_ReadyToMeetKetheric_0.text: Ketheric Thorm is waiting for us. Are we ready?

DaisyAD_FollowKetheric_0.text: That tentacle was colossal. The same creature we encountered before. We must follow where it went.

DaisyAD_FollowKetheric_1.text: That tentacle was colossal. How can such a thing be possible?

Jaheira_Following_5.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following_5.text: Our host is at the top of the tower. Rude to keep him waiting, no?

Jaheira_Following_6.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following_6.text: It is I who follows you. But, if I must venture some advice... this is the simple part. Ketheric dies, or we do. And the Sword Coast with us.

Jaheira_Following_4.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_Following_4.text: I'll watch our backs. Call if you need me.

AssaultHarper_002_0.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002_0.text: This place is all dark corners. Stay sharp, eh?
AssaultHarper_002_0.context: NodeContext: Tense, in the heart of the enemy's tower.

AssaultHarper_002_1.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002_1.text: I hope... I hope we get a chance to see to the dead.
AssaultHarper_002_1.context: NodeContext: Coming down from battle adrenaline.

AssaultHarper_002_2.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002_2.text: Ilmater's ashes, but I hope you're half the fighter you look.
AssaultHarper_002_2.context: NodeContext: Chuckling nervously - a soldier who's never been to battle before. First phrase is an oath: 'By Christ', etc

AssaultHarper_002_3.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002_3.text: We'll hold the rear - you charge ahead.
AssaultHarper_002_3.context: NodeContext: Tense, in the heart of the enemy's tower.

AssaultHarper_002_5.speaker: Harper Grenywald
AssaultHarper_002_5.text: Press on. Make this worth it.
AssaultHarper_002_5.context: NodeContext: Putting a lot of faith in us

JaheiraThroneRoomOrders_0.speaker: Jaheira
JaheiraThroneRoomOrders_0.text: Patrol this floor, Harpers. Watch the doors and watch the windows. Nothing enters or exits these rooms alive.

AssaultFlamingFist_003_1.speaker: Fist Rhed
AssaultFlamingFist_003_1.text: I hope you find whatever rock Ketheric has crawled under. This land deserves to see the light again.
AssaultFlamingFist_003_1.context: NodeContext: Resolute, genuine hatred for Ketheric

AssaultFlamingFist_003_2.speaker: Fist Rhed
AssaultFlamingFist_003_2.text: That thing that cut a trail for us... I almost forgot what true light looked like.
AssaultFlamingFist_003_2.context: NodeContext: Wondering, referring to Nightsong - an avenging angel who pushed back Shar's darkness and cut a path for them

AssaultFlamingFist_003_3.speaker: Fist Rhed
AssaultFlamingFist_003_3.text: I'll fight my way to the tower-top, if only to see that light again.

AssaultFlamingFist_003_4.speaker: Fist Rhed
AssaultFlamingFist_003_4.context: NodeContext: Solemn - a blessing (god be with you)

PAD_AfterKethericCombat_0.speaker: Player
PAD_AfterKethericCombat_0.text: That thing came from below. We need to find out where it took Ketheric.

AD_PrisonWarden_0.speaker: The Warden
AD_PrisonWarden_0.text: I'll smear your entrails on these walls. In Her name!

TentaclelessJump_0.context: CinematicNodeContext: Black screen and noise of player sliding - then HEAVY THUD. Fade in to find party standing, dusting themselves off.

TentaclelessJump_12.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shots of eerie organic architecture.

TentaclelessJump_5.text: This must be where they harvest the tadpoles. We're close to the source of the infections.
TentaclelessJump_5.context: CinematicNodeContext: Shots of eerie organic architecture.

TentaclelessJump_9.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player standing, facing down long dark tunnel ahead.

TentaclelessJump_3.speaker: Narrator
TentaclelessJump_3.text: *The hole yawns back at you, impossibly wide - a single tentacle burrowed through stone.*
TentaclelessJump_3.context: CinematicNodeContext: Player looking at yawning hole warily

TentaclelessJump_6.speaker: Lae'zel
TentaclelessJump_6.text: Tsk'va. Fathomless as the gith's suffering under the ghaik.

TentaclelessJump_8.speaker: Shadowheart
TentaclelessJump_8.text: You don't actually want to jump, do you...?

TentaclelessJump_4.speaker: Karlach
TentaclelessJump_4.text: Looks like a long way down. Shall I go first?

TentaclelessJump_11.speaker: Astarion
TentaclelessJump_11.text: What are you - no. We are not jumping down there.

TentaclelessJump_7.speaker: Wyll
TentaclelessJump_7.text: The gaping abyss. You don't intend to jump - or do you?

TentaclelessJump_10.speaker: Gale
TentaclelessJump_10.text: Please tell me you don't mean to jump down that... oesophagus. The thought alone makes my own jump the other way.

AD_GuardObserver_0.speaker: Zealot Arden
AD_GuardObserver_0.text: Come at me - come on, then!
AD_GuardObserver_0.context: InternalNodeContext: intentionally weirdNodeContext: high on the possibility of battle

AssaultFlamingFist_004_0.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_0.text: We'll hold this point. Give Ketheric our regards, aye?
AssaultFlamingFist_004_0.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - they've fought all the way up the tower, and now it's up to us

AssaultFlamingFist_004_1.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_1.context: NodeContext: Grim resolve - they've fought all the way up the tower, and now it's up to us

AssaultFlamingFist_004_2.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_2.text: Bloody. Steps. Give me a level battlefield any time.
AssaultFlamingFist_004_2.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of breath

AssaultFlamingFist_004_3.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_3.context: NodeContext: Still a little out of breath

AssaultFlamingFist_004_4.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_4.text: Ready to move, boss. At your command.
AssaultFlamingFist_004_4.context: NodeContext: A little out of breath but trying to hide it.

AssaultFlamingFist_004_5.speaker: Fist Hadenwell
AssaultFlamingFist_004_5.text: Gods, but I hate fighting cultists. Godsick fools never think to surrender.
AssaultFlamingFist_004_5.context: NodeContext: Catching his breath from the battle

AD_ZrellCallout_2.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellCallout_2.text: Your corpses will look magnificent hanging from the parapets.

AD_ZrellCallout_3.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellCallout_3.text: The Absolute guides our swords. You have nothing.

AD_BarnabusCombat_1.speaker: 'Barnabus'
AD_BarnabusCombat_1.context: NodeContext: Hoarse, pained speech - this mouth was never made to form 'human speech', but the gnoll is giving a rallying cry to fight on our side. (Saying its own name and attacking)

AD_JaheiraFollowerLeave_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraFollowerLeave_0.text: Where are we going? The battle is back the other way.

AD_JaheiraFollowerLeave_1.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraFollowerLeave_1.text: Ketheric will not wait on our pleasure, nor jump on his sword without our aid. I go back to the battle - find me when you are ready to fight.

AD_WardenWaiting_1.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenWaiting_1.text: I didn't sign up to face a contingent of rabid do-gooders.

AD_WardenWaiting_3.speaker: The Warden
AD_WardenWaiting_3.text: I almost hope they break through. It'll make a change from beating on prisoners.

AD_ZrellTaunt_1.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellTaunt_1.text: What's the matter? Are you frightened of your fate?

AD_ZrellTaunt_3.speaker: Disciple Z'rell
AD_ZrellTaunt_3.text: Poor little infidel afraid to face the one true god.

Jaheira_0.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_0.text: Onward. Let the words of Alaundo ring true.

Jaheira_22.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_22.text: As long as we hold this floor, the tower is ours. I'll stay here - ensure no one comes up or down without a scimitar welcome.

Jaheira_30.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_30.text: You're close now. A final audience with Ketheric Thorm awaits.

Jaheira_65.speaker: Player
Jaheira_65.text: I detect a hint of envy. Perhaps you'd like to be there for that finale.

Jaheira_19.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_19.text: Keen eye. I suppose I could be persuaded.

Jaheira_94.speaker: Player
Jaheira_94.text: On second thought, it is rather vital that this floor remains secured.

Jaheira_7.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_7.text: Say no more. Just get the job done.

Jaheira_125.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_125.text: May you strike like the viper and choke like the vine. Good luck.

Jaheira_40.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_40.text: Later. We have enemies to silence first.

Jaheira_45.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_45.text: I stand ready to reinforce, if you need it.
Jaheira_45.context: NodeContext: Query - she's ready to fight if we need to recruit her

Jaheira_55.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_55.text: 'Unshackled from shadows, she will rise in moonlit glory and carve a path of brightness to the accursed one's second death.'
Jaheira_55.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Jaheira looks up to where Nightsong is hovering over Moonrise Towers.

Jaheira_27.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_27.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) For this line she looks away from Nightsong and looks to us.

Jaheira_4.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_4.text: Seems like his prophecy missed a crucial part, though. Didn't say who gave the angel back her wings.

Jaheira_80.speaker: Player
Jaheira_80.text: I'm not in it for the glory. Victory is all that matters.

Jaheira_110.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_110.text: My Harpers are gone, shadows lost in the shadow theatre of my mind alone.

Jaheira_106.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_106.text: I'm the last one standing, but I wouldn't be if it weren't for you. So what do you say? Shall we take the final steps together?

Jaheira_79.speaker: Player
Jaheira_79.text: A finale for the great Jaheira? I wouldn't miss it for the world.

Jaheira_24.speaker: Player
Jaheira_24.text: If you're the last Harper standing, it's only fitting that you walk alone.

Jaheira_98.speaker: Player
Jaheira_98.text: Let's just concentrate on the fight ahead. The real battle has yet to begin.

Jaheira_96.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_96.text: Believe me, I'm aching to have my revenge.

Jaheira_111.speaker: Player
Jaheira_111.text: The words of a dead man mean nothing.

Jaheira_63.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_63.text: Perhaps they don't. I care not. I care only for vengeance.

Jaheira_23.speaker: Player
Jaheira_23.text: Crazy old woman. You're talking to yourself.

Jaheira_60.speaker: Player
Jaheira_60.text: I'm- I'm sorry you're alone. That Last Light went as it did.

Jaheira_78.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_78.text: It's all up to you now. Ketheric awaits.

Jaheira_76.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Gathered at the bridge that leads to Moonrise Towers stand Jaheira and her Harpers, flanked (potentially) by Counselor Florrick and her Flaming Fist soldiers. They’ve made it here through Nightsong’s corridor of light, while Nightsong herself flies dramatically over the tower.

Jaheira_25.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_25.text: 'Unshackled from shadows, she will rise in moonlit glory and carve a path of brightness to the accursed one's second death.'
Jaheira_25.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) Jaheira looks up to where Nightsong is hovering over Moonrise Towers.

Jaheira_32.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_32.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) For this line she looks away from Nightsong and looks to us with a mischievous smile.

Jaheira_34.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_34.text: That beacon of angelic wrath has taken the fight to Ketheric on the rooftop, and the first line of defence are dead.

Jaheira_39.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_39.text: But storming the tower won't be easy, and if we wait too long, Ketheric will gather his strength and retaliate.
Jaheira_39.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) When she says “You’ll have your hands full storming the tower”, she point towards the MT entrance where the enemy stands guard.

Jaheira_41.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_41.text: For now though, he's on the back foot for the first time since he returned from the grave.

Jaheira_52.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_52.text: This is it - the spearhead moment. You've brought us this far, so how shall we proceed?

Jaheira_81.speaker: Player
Jaheira_81.text: We move in and secure the ground floor first - cut off all exits.

Jaheira_20.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_20.text: A sound strategy. Once it's done, me and my Harpers will hold the ground floor while you hunt down the general himself.

Jaheira_62.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_62.text: Florrick left some of her Flaming Fist - they'll scout the prisons and barracks below, to ensure we're not taken by surprise.

Jaheira_16.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_16.text: Say the word, and we're off.

Jaheira_105.speaker: Player
Jaheira_105.text: Actually, I'd rather you join my party, Jaheira.

Jaheira_91.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_91.text: I'm touched. But I'm already spoken for.
Jaheira_91.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) She nods towards the assembled Harpers.

Jaheira_12.speaker: Player
Jaheira_12.text: Ketheric is a formidable foe. I have need of a formidable ally.

Jaheira_5.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_5.text: Very well. Side by side we'll stand as we'll rip True Souls from a false god. As good a prophecy as any.

Jaheira_47.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_47.text: At the ready, Harpers! In this light there will be victory! In this light we will avenge the fallen!

Jaheira_13.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) The assembled soldiers raise their weapons and cheer. Shouts of ‘Victory!’ resound.

Jaheira_3.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_3.text: The time has come. Ketheric will taste of death at last.

Jaheira_93.speaker: Player
Jaheira_93.text: Your Harpers are big boys and girls. They can handle themselves.

Jaheira_114.speaker: Player
Jaheira_114.text: So be it. See you on the other side.

Jaheira_36.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_36.text: Godsspeed. You seem to be their chosen champion after all, against the false Absolute.

Jaheira_124.speaker: Player
Jaheira_124.text: You're the High Harper. You tell me.

Jaheira_84.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_84.text: If you're hunting one target among many, the key is to isolate and corner it.

Jaheira_83.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_83.text: My Harpers and I will be the noose that closes in around Ketheric, and as it tightens, you'll go in for the kill.

Jaheira_101.speaker: Player
Jaheira_101.text: Do what you will, just don't get in my way.

Jaheira_100.speaker: Player
Jaheira_100.text: I reap every soul in this tower, until we are the last creatures standing.

Jaheira_77.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_77.text: Sounds like something my scimitars would say. They'll strike true. See to it you'll do the same.

Jaheira_54.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_54.text: Ready your weapons, Harpers. Be prepared to strike at my command.

Jaheira_10.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_10.text: Well, that spared us all a tedious confrontation. We'll settle this by the sword.
Jaheira_10.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) She dramatically draws her two scimitars in preparation for combat.

Jaheira_69.speaker: Player
Jaheira_69.text: What criterion is it that would put me in either camp?

Jaheira_48.speaker: Player
Jaheira_48.text: I am not a True Soul.

Jaheira_18.speaker: Player
Jaheira_18.text: I'm on your side if that's what you're insinuating. On the Harpers' side.

Jaheira_21.speaker: Player
Jaheira_21.text: That celestial being up there? I'm the one who freed her.

Jaheira_104.speaker: Player
Jaheira_104.text: You saw that celestial being flying over the tower, am I right? Well, I'm the one who freed her.

Jaheira_116.speaker: Player
Jaheira_116.text: All you need to know is that I'm here to kill Ketheric Thorm.

Jaheira_122.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_122.text: In that case we could find ourselves to be allies indeed. Me and my Harpers came all the way from Baldur's Gate to end the cult of the Absolute once and for all.

Jaheira_58.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_58.text: I'm Jaheira, and if our goals align, I may just be pleased to meet you.

Jaheira_9.speaker: Player
Jaheira_9.text: Let me prove it to you - join my party.

Jaheira_15.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_15.text: This is it then. The assault commences.

Jaheira_103.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_103.text: The time has come. Ketheric Thorm will taste of death at last.

Jaheira_67.speaker: Player
Jaheira_67.text: Baldur's Gate? Does that mean the Absolute has spread to the city as well?

Jaheira_119.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_119.text: We can talk at length once the day is won - so let's win it first.

Jaheira_118.speaker: Player
Jaheira_118.text: Let's circle this conversation back to some kind of point, shall we?

Jaheira_38.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_38.text: The sword-point is the only one that matters now.

Jaheira_107.speaker: Player
Jaheira_107.text: I don't need to prove myself to anyone. Now step aside.

Jaheira_68.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_68.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) She dramatically draws her two scimitars in preparation for combat.

Jaheira_70.speaker: Player
Jaheira_70.text: Must I stumble upon another nuisance every other mile? Out of my way, the lot of you!

Jaheira_28.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_28.text: Foe it is. Strike them down.
Jaheira_28.context: CinematicNodeContext: (Cine) She dramatically draws her two scimitars in preparation for combat.

Jaheira_102.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_102.text: You fight well - with skill and purpose.

Jaheira_51.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_51.text: I'll hold this floor to ensure no one can escape the tower. You must press on, and find Ketheric Thorm.

Jaheira_73.speaker: Player
Jaheira_73.text: Actually, Jaheira, why don't you join me?

Jaheira_6.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_6.text: I can't quite put my finger on why I trust you, but I do: the same instinct through which I know a wolf will bite, or allow itself to be petted.

Jaheira_26.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_26.text: You'll bite. But not me. Not as long as we run in the same pack.

Jaheira_113.speaker: Player
Jaheira_113.text: Then consider yourself part of the pack.

Jaheira_90.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_90.text: So I shall. Now let's run a hunt.

Jaheira_99.speaker: Jaheira
Jaheira_99.text: Different packs then. As you wish. Just get the job done.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_0.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_0.text: We're pushing them back. The Moonmaiden's with us.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_1.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_1.text: We're pushing them back. The Moonmaiden's with us.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_2.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_2.text: The Moonmaiden's light will protect us - even here.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_3.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_3.text: There'll be plenty of dead to mourn, when this is done. But songs to sing, too.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_5.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_5.text: Can't say I was sure of you until this very moment, 'True Soul'. But you gave us a chance.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_6.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_6.text: That light in the sky... I almost feel bad for Ketheric, knowing what's coming for him.

HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_7.speaker: Harper Antony
HavenOutcasts_BarricadeRunners_Ranger_7.text: Our Lady's light go with you.

AD_JaheiraMoveForward_0.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraMoveForward_0.text: Hold every exit - let none escape to warn the army of our assault.

AD_JaheiraMoveForward_1.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraMoveForward_1.text: Hold this floor, Harpers! Let none escape the tower. We're about to trap the spider in its own web.

AD_JaheiraMoveForward_2.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraMoveForward_2.text: We've taken the tower. No doubt its master waits to greet us above.

AD_JaheiraMoveForward_3.speaker: Jaheira
AD_JaheiraMoveForward_3.text: Harpers - hold this floor. Let none escape to warn the army - not until we've put Ketheric down.

PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning_1.speaker: Player
PAD_PrisonSkeletonWarning_1.text: The battle won't be won down here.

AssaultHarper_004_0.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_0.text: Gods above, the tadpoles. I think I saw one crawl out of a corpse.
AssaultHarper_004_0.context: NodeContext: Hint of nausea - very much a rookie

AssaultHarper_004_1.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_1.text: If that army outside stirs, we'll keep them off your back.
AssaultHarper_004_1.context: NodeContext: Summoning courage but still queasy

AssaultHarper_004_2.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_2.text: Wish I'd used the latrine. Always need to, before a battle.

AssaultHarper_004_3.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_3.text: I'll stand, don't you worry. Jaheira's watching, after all.
AssaultHarper_004_3.context: NodeContext: Little nervous, trying to convince themselves and us both

AssaultHarper_004_4.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_4.text: Can't believe you've got one of those worms in your head. Lucky for us you're on our side.
AssaultHarper_004_4.context: NodeContext: Hint of nausea - very much a rookie

AssaultHarper_004_5.speaker: Harper Olys
AssaultHarper_004_5.text: Put an end to this. Please.
AssaultHarper_004_5.context: NodeContext: Half supportive, half pleading. Just wants the fighting to be over.
